interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Sister Act
Review Date: 2015/06/05
Store: Whoopi Goldberg  (Actor),     Maggie Smith  (Actor),     Adam Greenberg  (Director),     Emile Ardolino  (Director)    &                   1                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment, Live Action, All Titles
Product Description: ["Relive all the fun, laughter, and irresistible music of SISTER ACT -- the inspired comedy hit that packed pews everywhere! Whoopi Goldberg stars as a sassy, low-rent lounge singer forced to hide out from the mob in the last place on earth anyone would look for her -- a convent. While she's there, her irreverent behavior attracts a flock of faithful followers and turns the nuns' tone-deaf choir into a soulful chorus of swingin', singin' sisters. But when the group earns rave reviews, her sudden celebrity jeopardizes her hidden identity. Harvey Keitel and Kathy Najimy join a heavenly cast in this habit-forming comedy bursting with '60s Motown hits."]
Average Rating: 4.8

reference_summary:
Singin' in the Rain
Gene Kelly  (Actor, Director),     Donald O'Connor  (Actor),     Stanley Donen  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    G    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas, Comedy
["Silent movies are giving way to talking pictures - and a hoofer-turned-matinee idol (Gene Kelly) is caught in the bumpy transition, as are his buddy (Donald, O'Connor), a prospective ladylove (Debbie Reynolds) and shrewish costar (Jean Hagen). Rediscover the musical masterpiece, Singin' In The Rain, in dazzling, restored high definition, featuring an all-new documentary special feature that salutes not just this all-time favorite but also the musical legacy of its producer, songwriter Arthur Freed."]

A Christmas Carol
George C. Scott  (Actor),     David Warner  (Actor),     Clive Donner  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Science Fiction, General
['Christmas elicits nothing more than "Bah, humbug!" from Ebenezer Scrooge (Scott), a miser whose sole pursuit of financial success has left him a bitter and lonely old man. But a Christmas Eve visit from the Ghosts of Christmas Past, Present and Future ultimately teaches him to open his heart to the spirit of Christmas and to the joys of friends and family.']

Our favorite Christmas movie!
Five Stars
It's a Wonderful Life [Blu-ray]
James Stewart  (Actor),     Donna Reed  (Actor),     Frank Capra  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
['Product Description', 'Ruined by a miser on Christmas Eve, a suicidal family man sees life anew thanks to his guardian angel.', 'Amazon.com', "It's a Wonderful Life", 'Now perhaps the most beloved American film,', "It's a Wonderful Life", "was largely forgotten for years, due to a copyright quirk. Only in the late 1970s did it find its audience through repeated TV showings. Frank Capra's masterwork deserves its status as a feel-good communal event, but it is also one of the most fascinating films in the American cinema, a multilayered work of Dickensian density. George Bailey (played superbly by James Stewart) grows up in the small town of Bedford Falls, dreaming dreams of adventure and travel, but circumstances conspire to keep him enslaved to his home turf. Frustrated by his life, and haunted by an impending scandal, George prepares to commit suicide on Christmas Eve. A heavenly messenger (Henry Travers) arrives to show him a vision: what the world would have been like if George had never been born. The sequence is a vivid depiction of the American Dream gone bad, and probably the wildest thing Capra ever shot (the director's optimistic vision may have darkened during his experiences making military films in World War II). Capra's triumph is to acknowledge the difficulties and disappointments of life, while affirming--in the teary-eyed final reel--his cherished values of friendship and individual achievement.", "It's a Wonderful Life", 'was not a big hit on its initial release, and it won no Oscars (Capra and Stewart were nominated); but it continues to weave a special magic.', '--Robert Horton']
{'Format': 'Blu-ray, Black & White, Color, Original recording remastered, Subtitled, Dubbed', 'Contributor': 'Donna Reed, Henry Travers, Gloria Grahame, Frank Capra, Ward Bond, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell, James StewartDonna Reed, Henry Travers, Gloria Grahame, Frank Capra, Ward Bond, Lionel Barrymore, Thomas Mitchell, James Stewart  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 11 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': '97360720945', 'Director': 'Frank Capra', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray, Black & White, Color, Original recording remastered, Subtitled, Dubbed', 'Run time': '2 hours and 11 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 28, 2016', 'Actors': 'James Stewart, Donna Reed, Henry Travers, Gloria Grahame, Lionel Barrymore', 'Dubbed': 'French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Number of discs': '2'}
We watch it every year!
Five Stars
The Searchers [Blu-ray]
John Wayne  (Actor),     Ward Bond  (Actor)    Rated:    Unrated    Format: Blu-ray
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, Blu-ray, Westerns
['Product Description', 'Searchers, The (BD)', ']]>', 'Amazon.com', "A favorite film of some of the world's greatest filmmakers, including Martin Scorsese and Steven Spielberg, John Ford's", 'The Searchers', "has earned its place in the legacy of great American films for a variety of reasons. Perhaps most notably, it's the definitive role for John Wayne as an icon of the classic Western--the hero (or antihero) who must stand alone according to the unwritten code of the West. The story takes place in Texas in 1868; Wayne plays Ethan Edwards, a Confederate veteran who visits his brother and sister-in-law at their ranch and is horrified when they are killed by marauding Comanches. Ethan's search for a surviving niece (played by young Natalie Wood) becomes an all-consuming obsession. With the help of a family friend (Jeffrey Hunter) who is himself part Cherokee, Ethan hits the trail on a five-year quest for revenge. At the peak of his masterful talent, director Ford crafts this classic tale as an embittered examination of racism and blind hatred, provoking Wayne to give one of the best performances of his career. As with many of Ford's classic Westerns,", 'The Searchers', 'must contend with revisionism in its stereotypical treatment of "savage" Native Americans, and the film\'s visual beauty (the final shot is one of the great images in all of Western culture) is compromised by some uneven performances and stilted dialogue. Still, this is undeniably one of the greatest Westerns ever made.', '--Jeff Shannon']

Blue Sky [DVD]
Jessica Lange  (Actor),     Tommy Lee Jones  (Actor),     Tony Richardson  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG-13    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
["It was a time when blond bombshells splashed Life covers and A-bomb tests mushroomed in the desert. The older generation believed in their government, while younger people protested against it. And Blue Sky captures it all! Politically charged and erotically explosive, this highly combustible film features powerful performances by Jessica Lange (Rob Roy) in an Academy AwardÂ(r)-winning* role, and dynamic OscarÂ(r) winner** Tommy Lee Jones (Men in Black). Hard-working, mild-tempered Army scientist Hank Marshall (Jones) has his hands full with explosive nuclear reactors and the equally volatile Carly (Lange), his beautifully spirited and emotionally vulnerable wife. While he's conducting tests in Nevada, she succumbs to the advances of his superior officer! But her infidelity is not the only dilemma the Marshalls have to face. When a deadly military cover-up puts Hank in jeopardy, it's up to Carly to muster the courage and strength tosave the man she loves! *1994: Actress **1993: Supporting Actor, The Fugitive"]

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Interests in Classic Film:** Enjoys a diverse range of classic films, emphasizing musicals, comedies, family-friendly holiday movies, and classic Westerns. Recently, there has been an expansion into dramatic narratives that depict historical and political themes, resonating with timeless storytelling and nostalgic sentiments.

- **Appreciation for Quality:** Prioritizes high-quality, restored editions and notable adaptations, reflecting a commitment to preserving cinematic legacies across various genres, particularly historical dramas.

- **Family-Friendly Choices:** Maintains a strong preference for family-oriented content, predominantly selecting G-rated and PG-rated films. The interest now encompasses mature narratives with significant cultural influence, ensuring suitability for a broader audience while highlighting family values.

- **Engagement with Film History:** Exhibits a growing fascination with the historical context and political dimensions of classic films, particularly those addressing complex societal issues and moral dilemmas. 

- **Positive User Experience:** Continues to share enthusiastic reviews that emphasize enjoyment of cinematic experiences. Recently rated a favorite movie five stars, demonstrating a well-rounded appreciation for the entertainment value and deeper meanings in classic films.

Overall, this user embraces diverse cinematic experiences, favoring high-quality films that deliver engaging narratives, historical significance, and family-friendly themes, fostering connections across generations while exploring the richness of storytelling in film.
